title: Retro Leather Tooling & Craft
description: Remember tooling leather wallets and belts? Test your knowledge of this classic hands-on hobby!

questions.question: What type of leather, specifically tanned using natural materials, was the standard choice for tooling and carving?
What was the first step in preparing vegetable-tanned leather for tooling?
Which tool was used to transfer a pattern onto dampened leather by tracing over a design?
What specialized knife with a rotating blade was used to cut design lines into leather?
What was the most common beginner's project in leather crafting kits sold at hobby shops?
Which company was the best-known supplier of leather crafting tools and supplies, with stores and mail-order catalogs?
What metal stamps, struck with a mallet, were used to create textured backgrounds and decorative borders on leather?
options: Leather stamps (background and figure carving stamps)

questions.question: What technique involved using heat and pressure to create a design in leather?
What type of thread or cord was traditionally used for hand-sewing leather?
What two-pronged tool was used to create evenly spaced stitch holes along the edge of leather?
options: A stitching groover and pricking iron

questions.question: What was applied to finished leather projects to add color?
What protective finish was applied to dyed leather to seal and protect the surface?
What popular leather project, often given as a gift, was personalized with a tooled name or initials?
Where did many young people first learn leather tooling as a structured activity?
What type of surface did leather workers use underneath their projects to protect their work tables?
options: A marble slab or granite stone
